reference.title: AArch64 AMU registers
reference.shortdesc: This chapter describes the AArch64 AMU registers and shows examples of how to use them.

link.desc: The following table gives a summary of the Cortexâ€‘A76 AMU registers in the AArch64 Execution state.

link.linktext: AMCNTENCLR_EL0, Activity Monitors Count Enable Clear Register, EL0
link.desc: The AMCNTENCLR_EL0 disables the activity monitor counters implemented, AMEVCNTR0-4.

link.linktext: AMCNTENSET_EL0, Activity Monitors Count Enable Set Register, EL0
link.desc: The AMCNTENSET_EL0 enables the activity monitor counters implemented, AMEVCNTRn (n is 0-4).

link.linktext: AMCFGR_EL0, Activity Monitors Configuration Register, EL0
link.desc: The AMCFGR_EL0 provides information on the number of activity counters implemented and their size.

link.linktext: AMUSERENR_EL0, Activity Monitor EL0 Enable access, EL0
link.desc: The AMUSERENR_EL0 enables or disables EL0 access to the activity monitors.

link.linktext: AMEVCNTRn_EL0, Activity Monitor Event Counter Register, EL0
link.desc: The activity counters AMEVCNTRn_EL0 are directly accessible in the memory mapped-view. n is 0-4.

link.linktext: AMEVTYPERn_EL0, Activity Monitor Event Type Register, EL0
link.desc: The activity counters AMEVTYPER_EL0n are directly accessible in the memory mapped view, where n is 0-4.
